document_data.name: ''One Old Crone's Simperings: Seventy Seasons at Court''
document_data.author: [[Althea Bleth]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''One Old Crone's Simperings: Seventy Seasons at Court''''' was a memoir penned penned by Marchioness [[Althea Bleth]] of the noble [[Bleth]] family of [[Suzail]] in the early 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. {{quote|In all my long years of pomp and splendor
Of revels and feasts and grand [[High Court]] balls,
I've found little that's worth more than a good back rub
And nothing that's worth less than the word of a nobleman.|Excerpt from ''''One Old Crone's Simperings.''}}
document_data.History: ''One Old Crone's Simperings: Seventy Seasons at Court'' was a [[book]] that detailed the life, intrigues, and ruminations of the Suzailan courtier Lady Althea Bleth, who spent seventy years amidst the Forest Kingdom's High Court. The work saw print in the {{YearlinkName|1322}}.
